intro: Anthospermum ammannioides, commonly known as the Indian hibiscus or blue hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 3 meters in height, characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along riverbanks. The flowers are followed by capsule fruits that release seeds through a fleshy, explosive mechanism.
